bibl.title: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear, May 29, 1914

div1.p: Thomas Lazear transcribes a note written to him by Admiral Dewey on the fly leaf of Dewey's autobiography. The message praises Jesse Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear, May 29, 1914
div1.p:
I beg leave on this anniversary and in this time of
exposure to our sailors, soldiers and marines in Mexico, to
attest to the lasting debt of gratitude that rests on the nation
and its armed forces in particular, through the heroic sacrifice
of your ward and nephew Surgeon Jesse W. Lazear, U. S. Navy.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, GEORGE DEWEY. - - - - - - - -
The above is a copy of an inscription addressed to me by
Admiral George Dewey of U. S. Navy, in his own handwriting and which
he wrote on the fly leaf of a copy of his Autobiography presented to me
on my 83rd birthday, May 29th, 1914.
Tho. C. Lazear
